meanings.definition: Kept or preserved at low temperatures
meanings.sent1: The refrigerated drinks were nice and cold.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream was stored in a refrigerated container.
meanings.sent3: The penguins enjoyed the refrigerated habitat on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like a refrigerated block of ice after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The refrigerated room felt like stepping into a winter wonderland.

meanings.definition: To cool or preserve food by placing it in a refrigerator
meanings.sent1: She refrigerated the leftovers to keep them fresh.
meanings.sent2: Remember to refrigerate the milk after opening it.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally refrigerated the hot sauce, making it icy.
meanings.sent4: His words refrigerated the warmth of the room.
meanings.sent5: Refrigerated fruits last longer and taste better.

meanings.definition: Chilled or cooled to prevent spoilage
meanings.sent1: The refrigerated salad was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The picnic basket contained a variety of refrigerated snacks.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot in the refrigerated room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as cool and comforting as a refrigerated breeze.
meanings.sent5: The refrigerated air-conditioned room was a welcome relief from the heat.
